title: Make League available for Linux
body: That's what i'm really missing. the only reason i run a windows based system is to play league every now and then.

replies.body:
I'm a **huge fan** of Linux, and in fact, I was just installing the Elementary OS 0.4 Loki release on my Linux notebook last night. While there isn't official support, a *great majority* of players on Linux find success running League through [Wine](https://www.winehq.org/) or [PlayOnLinux](https://www.playonlinux.com/en/).

 I can't provide support for these methods, but if you need assistance along the way, I recommend reaching out on their forums. 

Let me know if you have any questions~ ^.^

https://cdn2.iconfinder.com/data/icons/oxygen/128x128/apps/tux.png

i have recently tried to launch league via "playonlinux" but i get a bugsplat instantly.. i seem to be the only one having this problem.. would you know anyone who could help me ? i no longer have a windows based computer, and i would hate to have to quit league due to this :(

As I said above, I cannot provide support for running League via *Wine* or *PlayOnLinux*. I recommend reaching out on the [*PlayOnLinux Forums*](https://www.playonlinux.com/en/forums.html) for assistance with your issue.

Best of luck, friend!
